summary: This document contains Bureau of Prisons financial records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including Western Union money transfers sent to him and commissary purchase invoices from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The records show transactions occurring in July and August 2019, shortly before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate at New York MCC with account number 76318054, receiving money transfers and making commissary purchases including batteries, toiletries, medication, and an AM/FM radio.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Sent $200 via Western Union to Jeffrey Epstein on August 7, 2019, from Brooklyn, NY.

persons.name: Ruben Rugard
persons.context: Sent $200 via Western Union to Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019, from New York, NY.

connections.description: Reyes sent $200 to Epstein via Western Union while Epstein was incarcerated.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was receiving money transfers from outside individuals while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York in July-August 2019.
Two individuals, Efrain Reyes and Ruben Rugard, each sent $200 to Epstein via Western Union during this period.
Epstein made multiple commissary purchases including an AM/FM radio, medications, toiletries, and vitamins while in custody.
These financial transactions occurred in the weeks immediately preceding Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The documents show Epstein had a prison account balance that fluctuated between approximately $165 and $640 during this period.
